benchmark_details.name: CogniLoad
benchmark_details.overview: CogniLoad is a novel synthetic benchmark grounded in Cognitive Load Theory (CLT) that generates natural language logic puzzles with tunable parameters to facilitate precise failure analysis and understanding of long-context reasoning in Large Language Models (LLMs).

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a multi-dimensional evaluation framework for long-context reasoning in LLMs by independently controlling parameters affecting intrinsic and extraneous cognitive loads.

data.source: Generated synthetic puzzles based on Cognitive Load Theory.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy is calculated as the proportion of correctly answered puzzles out of the total number of puzzles evaluated.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better reasoning capability of the model across different parameters of cognitive load.
methodology.validation: Features systematic, factorial control over cognitive load dimensions.
